result.execSummary:
The defendant Leighton R Brazwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leighton R Brazwell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leighton R Brazwell was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DEFENDANT AGREED TO $15 PAYMENT PLAN FEE TO BE ADDED TO PAYMENT PLAN. $50 PER MONTH COMMENCING JANUARY 5, 2016

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leighton R Brazwell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Leighton R Brazwell
Current: 314 Eagle Dr, Grand Marsh, WI 53936 United States  (Effective: 01-25-2016)
Prior: W8630 Elk Ave Stop D, Oxford, WI 53952
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Leighton R Brazwell in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that a pre-trial was scheduled for October 27th however the defendant was unable to make it. Prior to court, the parties met and an offer was provided.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to proceed today.  
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney and wants to proceed.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1. Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in January 2016
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Pre-trial conference at 10-27-2015 10:00 am.
Return date at 11-04-2015 03:30 pm.

Defendant Leighton R Brazwell in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court finds probable cause.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
